# Tender Announcement: Indigenous Advisory Services

## Title
Indigenous Advisory Services - PSIB Set-aside

## Reference Number
cb-416-68962987

## Amendment Number
4

5000078601/A

## Publication Date
2024-02-16

## Closing Date
2024-03-04T14:00:00

## Amendment Date
2024-03-04

## Expected Contract Dates
No dates specified

## Tender Status
Expired

## Description
The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC) seeks a qualified supplier to provide Indigenous Advisory Services under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) set-aside. The successful contractor will provide strategic advice to the CNSC's President and senior executive team to inform policies and regulatory approaches to advancing Reconciliation.

## Requirements

* Strategic planning consultation services
* Indigenous peoples relations consultation and engagement
* Change management communication and advisory services

## Level of Security
At least a Protected B level of security required for the company and resources

## Estimated Level of Effort
500 hours in the initial contract period, 400 hours in option year 1, and 300 hours in option year 2

## Period of Contract
1-year initial period, with 2 one-year options to extend the term

## Procurement Method
Competitive, Selective Tendering

## Selection Criteria
Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

## Notice URL
None

## Notice Attachments
None

## Contact Information
solicitation-demandedesoumission@cnsc-ccsn.gc.ca, (613) 415-6258

## Regions of Operation
Canada

## Regions of Delivery
National Capital Region (NCR)

The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission has issued a tender call for Indigenous Advisory Services under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business. The successful contractor will provide strategic advice to the CNSC's President and senior executive team to inform policies and regulatory approaches to advancing Reconciliation.

The contract term will be for 1 year, with two 1-year options to extend. The estimated level of effort for the initial contract period is 500 hours, with 400 hours in option year 1 and 300 hours in option year 2.

The CNSC is seeking a qualified supplier who can meet the required level of security and provide the necessary advisory services. The tender is open to eligible suppliers only.
